definition: Fuxi or Fu Hsi, legendary Chinese emperor, trad. 2852-2738 BC, mythical creator of fishing, trapping and writing
to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt
surname Fu
same as Fuxi 伏羲[Fu2 Xi1], a mythical emperor/surname Xi
Fuxi or Fu Hsi, legendary Chinese emperor 2852-2738 BC, mythical creator of fishing, trapping, and writing

sentences.english: Taihao had another name, Fuxi, one of an ancient three emperors.
sentences.chinese: 太昊还有一个名字叫伏羲，也是中国古代三皇之一。

sentences.english: Rong Fu ethnic communities Puyang beat it at this time World War II.
sentences.chinese: 戎族打败伏羲族的濮阳大战也就在这个时候。

sentences.english: Fuxi lived here 6500 years ago and set the capital in this city.
sentences.chinese: 伏羲生活在年前并在淮阳建都。

sentences.english: Fuxi day bashing by the mosquito spider web inspired the creation of closed networks.
sentences.chinese: 伏羲一日受蜘蛛结网扑蚊子的启示，创造了结网。

sentences.english: The second is about the Fuxi and Nuwa myth that narrates the creation of human being.
sentences.chinese: 其次是关于人类创生的女娲和伏羲神话。

sentences.english: Chinese legend says that Fu Xi is the most senior one among the three ancestors.
sentences.chinese: 中国传说称伏羲氏三位祖先中地位最高的。

sentences.english: The earliest totem adoration started from the ancient times of Emperor Fuxi.
sentences.chinese: 我国最早的龙图腾产生于上古伏羲时代。

definition: the Yellow Emperor, mythological emperor of China, reigned c. 2697-2597 BC
Three Sovereigns, between Gods and Emperors in third millennium BC/usually listed as Suiren 燧人[Sui4 ren2], Fuxi 伏羲[Fu2 Xi1], trapping and writing, Shennong or Farmer God 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2]
Pangu (creator of the universe in Chinese mythology)
Flame Emperors (c. 2000 BC), legendary dynasty descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
Dijun, Shang dynasty protector God, possibly same as legendary Emperor 帝嚳|帝喾[Di4 Ku4]
Fuxi or Fu Hsi, legendary Chinese emperor 2852-2738 BC, mythical creator of fishing, trapping, and writing
alternative name for the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝
Suirenshi, legendary inventor of fire
Shennong or Farmer God (c. 2000 BC), first of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] and creator of agriculture
God of Water
God of heaven/Celestial emperor
Xi Wangmu, Queen Mother of the West, keeper of the peaches of immortality/popularly known as 王母娘娘
Chi You, legendary creator of metalworking and weapons/comet
Yu the Great (c. 21st century BC) mythical leader who tamed the floods

Five Legendary Emperors, usually taken to be the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4] and four of his sons Zhuan Xu 顓頊|颛顼[Zhuan1 Xu1], Di Ku 帝嚳|帝喾[Di4 Ku4], Tang Yao 唐堯|唐尧[Tang2 Yao2], Yu Shun 虞舜[Yu2 Shun4]
Nüwa (creator of humans in Chinese mythology)
